content.rendered:
The Iowa State University of Science and Technology’s (ISSO) Rosenfeld International Scholarships are open for application.

Contents on This Page

Toggle
  • Rosenfeld International Scholarships | Summary
    • Eligibility
    • How Can I Apply?
  • Benefits of the Scholarship

The study program is open to international students who hold an F-1 or J-1 visa and are interested in earning an undergraduate or graduate degree. Applicants must have a minimum GPA of 2.5 or 3.0 in order to be considered. It is anticipated that the Rosenfeld International Scholarships grant will be used to cover study-related costs, despite the fact that no specifics have been provided.

The Iowa State University of Science and Technology is a massive public land-grant research university in Ames, IOWA. It was founded in 1858. It is a respected university that is ranked 122nd in the nation and 237th globally for producing global citizens and leaders.

Rosenfeld International Scholarships | Summary

  • University Name: Iowa State University of Science and Technology (ISSO)
  • Study Level: Undergraduate / Graduate
  • Award: Tuition fee
  • Access Mode: Online
  • Nationality: International
  • The award can be taken in the USA
  • Application Deadline: Open

Eligibility

Candidates must satisfy all of the following requirements in order to be eligible for Rosenfeld International Scholarships:

  • International students can apply.
  • Programs taught at the undergraduate or graduate levels at Iowa State University of Science and Technology.
  • Candidates must meet all of the following requirements in order to be considered:
      • All applicants must be on an F-1 or J-1 visa.
      • Candidates must have a minimum grade point average of 2.5 (undergraduate) or 3.0 (graduate).

How Can I Apply?

To apply for the Rosenfeld International Scholarships, please follow the application instructions below:

  • To apply for admission, students must access the university portal. Students who meet the requirements for the scholarship will be considered.
  • The students are required to present the following documents to the university:
      • English proficiency exam results
      • Transcripts of all high schools or universities attended
      • Bank statement or sponsor letter
      • Copy of passport, and of visa (if available)
  • The applicants must meet the admission requirements of the university, typically high school graduation
  • The students must submit scores of the following English language proficiency tests:
      • TOEFL IBT – 71
      • IELTS – 6.0
      • Duolingo – 100
      • PTE –48

Benefits of the Scholarship

The Rosenfeld International Scholarship will be given to the applicants who come out on top to pay for their education at Iowa State University of Science and Technology (ISSO).

Click Here to Apply
